intro: Peucedanum eryngiifolium, commonly known as the thorned cow-wheat, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of the cow-wheat genus. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. Peucedanum eryngiifolium is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows.
